Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is greyish in section, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and very faint traces of at least three lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394620) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394620)
